recipe.title: How to Make Teriyaki Chicken
recipe.intro: Teriyaki chicken is a popular Japanese dish. The chicken has a sweet and shiny sauce.
recipe.ingredients: chicken thigh, soy sauce, mirin, sugar, vegetable oil, white sesame seeds
steps: **Cut** the chicken thigh into big pieces.
**Heat** oil in a pan on medium heat.
**Put** the chicken in the pan, skin side down, and cook for five minutes.
**Turn** the chicken over and cook for three more minutes.
**Add** soy sauce, mirin, and sugar to the pan.
**Cook** until the sauce is thick and shiny. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I visited The Rooftop Jasmine last Friday night. It was on top of a building at Kangaroo Point. I could see the city lights and the river from the rooftop. Jasmine flowers were everywhere and the smell was lovely. I ordered teriyaki chicken with rice. The sauce was sweet and the chicken was very tender. The night was warm and the pink lights made the place very romantic.

australia_tips.title: オーストラリアで照り焼きチキンを作るなら
australia_tips.content:
オーストラリアのスーパーでは鶏もも肉は「chicken thigh」として売っています。骨なしは「boneless」、皮つきは「skin on」と書いてあります。照り焼きには皮つきのものがおすすめです。

みりん（mirin）と醤油（soy sauce）はアジア食材コーナーで買えます。もしみりんがなければ、砂糖を少し多めに入れると近い味になります。

Kangaroo Pointはブリスベンの人気スポットです。川沿いのCliffs Parkからはブリスベンの街がきれいに見えます。夜景も美しいので、仕事終わりにお散歩するのもいいですね。

ワーホリ中にカフェやレストランで働くなら、「teriyaki」は海外でも通じる言葉です。オーストラリアでは照り焼きは「Teriyaki Chicken Bowl」としてフードコートでも人気があります。日本の味を知っていることは強みになりますよ。

conversation.scene: 職場のランチタイムに、同僚のSophieとお弁当について話す場面

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Sophie, what did you bring for lunch today?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Just a sandwich. What about you?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: I made teriyaki chicken and rice.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Oh, I love teriyaki! Did you make the sauce too?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Yes! I used soy sauce, mirin, and sugar.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: It smells so good. Is it hard to make?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: No, it is very easy. You just cook the chicken and add the sauce.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: That is fast! Can you teach me sometime?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Of course! We can cook together this weekend.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Great! I will buy the chicken. You bring the sauce.
